Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation
  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods that dictate the movements of the robot, ranging from atomic methods to move the robot a certain distance or turn the robot a certain angle to more complex and compound methods such as the traversal algorithm for the search zone and the return algorithm to go from the stranded cart back to the starting corner.
    Author:
    charlesbourbeau

    • Method Detail

      • gridToCord

        public static double gridToCord​(int index)
        Convert grid coordinate to actual coordinate (cm).
        Parameters:
        index - in tile unit
        Returns:
        actual distance (cm)

      • searchZoneTraversal

        public static void searchZoneTraversal()
        This function calls the a* algorithm in the PathFinder class multiple times to visit all the grid coordinates of the search zone. If the US sensor detects an obstacle, it will send the information to the PathFinder's map attribute and re-compute a new path to the closest unvisited grid coordinate. If the forward light sensor detect an object, assumed to be the stranded cart, this traversal is complete and the method stops.

      • carryBackStrandedCart

        public static void carryBackStrandedCart​(PathFinder pf)
        This functions calls the a* algorithm in the PathFinder class 3 times to go from the stranded cart discovery coordinate back to the starting corner while taking wider turns to account for the increased length of the robot with the cart. First to first travel to a buffered length away from the tunnel, secondly to traverse the tunnel with a minimal exit distance from the tunnel to avoid the collision of the cart and the tunnel exit, and thirdly to travel back to the starting corner.
        Parameters:
        pf - the PathFinder instance with information about the Wi-Fi params

      • coloredDotDetection

        public static void coloredDotDetection()
        This function performs a light sensor sweep above the stranded cart to figure out where the colored dot is positioned. From that information we can infer the position of the hook.

      • robotHookingPosition

        public static void robotHookingPosition()
        This function repositions the robot, after the colored dot detection, such that the robot is now in the appropriate position to begin the hooking process.

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo​(double x,

        Perform a operation to travel to a specified location based on the odometer. and user input
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate to travel to.
        y - coordinate to travel to.
        blocking - , whether the operation blocks the thread or immediate returns.

      • lightLocalizationHelper

        private static void lightLocalizationHelper()
        Light localization helper method for checking obstacle.

      • initialLocalization

        public static void initialLocalization()
        The initial Localization. Uses ultrasonic detection twice and find the min and travel distance based on sensor data.

      • faceTheClosestWall

        private static void faceTheClosestWall()
        Helper method to face towards the closest wall. Perform a 360 sweep to turn to the aggregate angle and a slow 60 degree sweep to turn get a accurate turn.

      • minorAngleCorrection

        private static void minorAngleCorrection()
        Assume start at an angle close to the reall value. Perform us localization and face toward the closest wall.

      • backup

        private static void backup()
        Assume the robot faces a wall. backup until a distance of a tile distance.

      • setSpeed

        Sets the speed of both motors to the same values.

        public static void moveStraightFor​(double distance,
                                   boolean blocking)
        Moves the robot straight for the given distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - in feet (tile sizes), may be negative
        blocking - , whether the method should block the thread until the move is complete or immediate return.

      • turnBy

        public static void turnBy​(double angle,
                          boolean blocking)
        Turns the robot by a specified angle. Positive is clockwise.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle by which to turn, in degrees
        blocking - , whether the method should block the thread until the move is complete or immediate return.
